example.name: just transitive
example.text: But Peter Brody, Magnascreen's president, says [Japanese companies]-1 are poised [*-1] to snatch the technology and put it to commercial use, just as they did with earlier U.S. innovations in color television and video recording.
example.arg: just as they did with earlier U.S. innovations in color television and video recording

example.name: with source
example.text: In January, two small New York galleries, the Coe Kerr Gallery and Beadleston Fine Arts, snatched a major art collection owned by the Askin family away from rival auction-house bidders with an up-front payment of about $25 million.
example.arg: two small New York galleries, the Coe Kerr Gallery and Beadleston Fine Arts,
a major art collection owned by the Askin family
with an up-front payment of about $25 million

predicate.note: Frames file for 'snatch' based on sentences in wsj.

example.name: all args
example.text: What would've happened if Lynard Skynard would have snatched away the microphone from Beyonce and said Taylor Swift deserved the award?

predicate.note: Frames file for 'snatch away' based on dictionary.com.
